section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Customer" means a person who subscribes to, or is financially responsible for a subscription to, telephone service from a telephone company.
"Telephone" means a device used by a person for voice communications transmitted in analog, data, or any other form.
"Telephone record" means information retained by a telephone company that relates to:
"Telephone record" does not include information collected or retained by customers using caller I.D. or similar technology.

text.section:
This section does not apply to:
a person acting under a valid court order, warrant, or subpoena; or
a law enforcement officer acting in the performance of official duty.

A person may not:
knowingly obtain, attempt to obtain, or solicit or conspire with another to obtain, a telephone record:
without the authorization of the customer to whom the record pertains; or
by fraudulent, deceptive, or false means;
knowingly sell or attempt to sell a telephone record without the authorization of the customer to whom the record pertains; or
receive a telephone record:
knowing that the record has been obtained without the authorization of the customer to whom the record pertains; or
by fraudulent, deceptive, or false means.

section.section: A violation of this section is an unfair or deceptive trade practice under Title 13 of the Commercial Law Article.
A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 2 years or a fine not exceeding $2,000 or both.

text.section:
Notwithstanding any other law, the prosecution for a violation of this section may be commenced in any county in which:
an element of the crime occurred; or
the victim resides.
